author: aeryzk
content: Hey, since the `LightClientHeader` does not include the attestations, is there a way for the light client to compute whether a checkpoint got justified(garnered supermajority of the attestations)?

author: etan_status
content:
nope, but there is ongoing work from <@544848504078598144> for a confirmation rule that will replace justified as the metric of 'safe block' / unlikely to be reorged.
adding the justified checkpoint does not drastically change UX, as the justified CP still lags minutes behind. so, the cost of including it in the packets so far was not considered to be worth it.

author: etan_status
content: I have created a document explaining the current state of light clients, and what could be reasonable to include with Electra: https://hackmd.io/@etan-status/electra-lc
